definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)

sentences.english: Long rain soon cleared up singing, smell.
sentences.chinese: 久雨聞鳥鳴，不久即轉晴。

sentences.english: I’m a reader of John Chow’s blog and follow John on twitter.
sentences.chinese: 我是約翰博客的忠實讀者，並且追隨他的《鳥鳴》。

sentences.english: Find out what I’m doing right now by following me on Twitter.
sentences.chinese: 到與我共同鳥鳴上看看我現在在幹什麼。

sentences.english: As we climbed, local warblers began to trill through the quietness and dogs barked in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 當我們攀爬時，鳥鳴和狗吠打破了當地的平靜。

sentences.english: pistols, which date back to roughly 1820, are attributed to the Rochat brothers, Swiss artisans who pioneered the art of mechanical singing birds.
sentences.chinese: 他們是開創了鳥鳴機械裝置藝術的瑞士鐘錶匠。

sentences.english: Give me to warble spontaneous songs recluse by myself.
sentences.chinese: 給我一種遁世，讓我獨自吟唱那如鳥鳴的隨性之歌。

definition: lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to chat with a low voice
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
